educational_objective: Diagnose bitemporal quadrant visual field defects secondary to a pituitary mass.
question_text: A 33-year-old woman is evaluated for diminished vision in the temporal fields.Results of visual field testing are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is a pituitary tumor (Option C). This patient's visual field testing demonstrates bitemporal superior/upper quadrant visual field defects suggestive of optic chiasm compression from a pituitary tumor. Suprasellar extension of a pituitary adenoma that compresses the optic chiasm can result in visual symptoms. The most common symptom is diminished vision in the temporal fields (bitemporal hemianopsia). A formal visual field examination is required for any tumor that abuts or compresses the optic chiasm.
